title.narrative: INTEGRATION OF CHILD PROTECTION

description.narrative: Relevant MDAs integrate Child Protection (CP) into their national programmes, which contributes to Child Protection â€“ General, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Improved and equitable prevention of and response to violence, abuse, exploitation and neglect of children

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Relevant MDAs integrate Child Protection (CP) into their national programmes

description.narrative: Relevant MDAs integrate Child Protection (CP) into their national programmes | Status:On-track | As-of Date:29/07/2016

title.narrative: % of districts that are implementing the Child Protection System in line with the National Guidelines

actual.value: 2016:20% of districts in Tanzania are implementing CP Systems Strengthening initiative.

title.narrative: % of villages in UN supported districts with functional MVC Committees

actual.value: 2016:80% of villages and streets in all LGAs implementing child protection systems strengthening on the mainland have functioning MVCC or similar structures attending to CP cases. 100% of villages in 10 wards each in the districts of Kisarawe, Kibaha, Shinynga, and Unguja West and 25% of villages in No

title.narrative: Relevant National Plans of Action being implemented as per plan at national level and in selected districts

baseline.value: 2007-10 NCPA does not adequately address CP issues

target.value: 2016:Implementation of Child Protection component of NCPA MVC II and the NPA on VAC progressing as planned, both plans monitored by the PMO.

actual.value: 2016:Implementation of NPA VAC was completed at the end of June and positively evaluated. NCPA II continues to be implemented within the established district Child Protection Systems in 35 districts in Tanzania and Zanzibar, 19 with direct UNICEF support. A new National Plan of Action on Violence Agains
